skill.author: 0xkynz

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no executable code. Only contains markdown documentation and instruction prompts. No file I/O, network calls, or code execution capabilities.

content.value_statement: Claude loses context between sessions. Memory Bank creates structured documentation that preserves project knowledge, decisions, and progress so you never lose your place.
actual_capabilities: Creates 6 structured Memory Bank files for project documentation
Updates activeContext.md and progress.md during sessions
Maintains file hierarchy from projectbrief.md to progress.md
Provides templates for all documentation files
Reads all Memory Bank files at session start
Documents technical decisions and system patterns
limitations: Does not auto-detect project structure or requirements
Requires user to provide initial project information
Does not integrate with external documentation tools
Memory Bank exists only in local memory-bank directory

use_cases.title: Resume interrupted work
use_cases.description: Pick up exactly where you left off in complex projects across sessions without re-explaining context.

use_cases.title: Document architectural decisions
use_cases.description: Record why technical decisions were made so future team members understand the reasoning.

use_cases.title: Knowledge transfer
use_cases.description: Share complete project context with new team members or between different AI assistants.

prompt_templates.title: Initialize Memory Bank
prompt_templates.prompt: Start a new memory bank for this project.

prompt_templates.title: Update Progress
prompt_templates.prompt: Update memory bank. I completed the user authentication module.

prompt_templates.title: Check Status
prompt_templates.prompt: What is the current state of the project from the memory bank?

prompt_templates.title: Full Documentation Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Update memory bank with all changes from this session.

output_examples.input: Start a new memory bank for my React e-commerce project
output: Created memory-bank/projectbrief.md - Please provide: project description, core requirements, main goals
Created memory-bank/productContext.md - Please describe the problem and your solution

best_practices: Keep files scannable with clear headers and bullet points
Update activeContext.md and progress.md at the end of every session
Include just enough context to resume work without overwhelming detail
anti_patterns: Treating Memory Bank as a to-do list instead of context documentation
Letting documentation drift from actual implementation state
Including implementation details that belong in code comments instead

faq.question: What is Memory Bank?
faq.answer: Memory Bank is a documentation system that preserves project context across Claude sessions using six structured markdown files.

faq.question: Does this work with all Claude products?
faq.answer: Yes, Memory Bank works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Files are stored locally in your project.

faq.question: How do I share context with my team?
faq.answer: Commit the memory-bank folder to version control. Team members can read the files to understand project context.

faq.question: What happens to my data?
faq.answer: All Memory Bank files are stored locally in your project directory. No data is sent to external servers.

faq.question: Can I use this with other AI assistants?
faq.answer: Yes, Memory Bank uses plain markdown files. Any AI or human can read and understand the documentation.

faq.question: How is this different from regular documentation?
faq.answer: Memory Bank is specifically designed for Claude's session structure with mandatory read order and update workflows.
